qualities: Accountability is a foundational principle of Trustworthy AI.
Accountability refers to the obligation of individuals, organizations, and institutions to take responsibility for the outcomes produced by AI systems.
Developers, deployers, and operators must remain accountable for the design choices, training data, deployment environments, and downstream impacts of their models.
Transparency enables stakeholders to audit systems and assign responsibility when harm occurs.
Accountable AI systems should provide clear documentation of model objectives, data provenance, risk assessments, and evaluation procedures.
Traceability allows decisions to be traced back to human oversight and documented processes.
Accountability ensures that decision-makers remain accountable for mitigating risks such as bias, discrimination, or violations of fundamental rights.
Accountable AI requires continuous monitoring to ensure ongoing compliance with ethical principles and legal standards.
Responsible parties must provide remedies and corrective actions if an AI system produces harmful outcomes.
Accountability reinforces the principle of fairness.
Accountability ensures that AI systems support equitable treatment and uphold the principle of fairness in automated decision-making processes.
Accountability is closely linked to governance and regulatory compliance in policy discussions.
Organizations deploying AI technologies are expected to establish internal governance mechanisms.
Internal governance mechanisms include impact assessments and escalation procedures.
Decision-makers must remain accountable for mitigating risks such as bias, discrimination, or violations of fundamental rights.
AI systems should be evaluated throughout their lifecycle to ensure ongoing compliance with ethical principles and legal standards.
Responsible parties must provide remedies and corrective actions if an AI system produces harmful outcomes.
Accountability reinforces the principle of fairness.
Accountability ensures that AI systems support equitable treatment and uphold the principle of fairness in automated decision-making processes.
